name: places/ChIJJbLe23z2wokRaGs39aJnDDk
formattedAddress: 1745 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10031, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1745 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10031-4607, USA

originalText.text: Lots of clean machines and all in working order. Great for me because even though I own a washer and dryer, I sometimes wash in large volume (5+ loads) and want to save time. I get large volume laundry done in  under 2 hrs by pre-sorting, bringing laundry supplies including coins and reading material so you don't piss off the laundromat staff who must do drop off orders while you are roaming the neighborhood for entertainment while your stuff occupies washers and dryers.

I get large volume laundry done in  under 2 hrs by pre-sorting, bringing laundry supplies including coins and reading material so you don't piss off the laundromat staff who must do drop off orders while you are roaming the neighborhood for entertainment while your stuff occupies washers and dryers.

originalText.text: The owner of this place is incredibly rude. He'll offer unsolicited comments on how you do your laundry. In the past- he's removed my laundry from a dryer and placed it on top of the dirty machines when I was less than 5 minutes late coming back to pick it up (and there was literally nobody else there). He also talks about people behind their backs in Spanish if he thinks you're not bilingual.

originalText.text:
Their closing time says 10 pm, yet when I put my clothes to wash before 8 pm they always tell me, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm the last one‚Äù, or ‚Äúwe‚Äôre closing early‚Äù. Don‚Äôt advertise closing at 10 if you really want to close at 9. Or better yet, don‚Äôt work there!

People that work there are rude and nasty. You can walk one more block and go to the laundromat on 147th. It‚Äôs smaller but the people that work there don‚Äôt hound you about what time THEY want to leave (unless you come 1.5 hours before, which is understandable).

originalText.text: This place is the worst! The owner is absolutely üíØ the worst in customer service. He approached me yelling that I cannot dry my clothes if I didn't wash them there. When I asked him where is the sign that says that he pointed to a small sign on the pillar inside the laundromat. I said why isn't this posted outside I didn't see it when I walked in. He started yelling you don't get to tell me where to put my signs and said I have to leave. He could've resolved this in a better fashion but was to irrate to be reasonable.

originalText.text: There's someone in charge of managing the place. They open at 7 a.m. Last wash is 8 p.m. so that they can close at 10 pm. Small loads are $2.50 and regular loads are $3.50. Coin operated.
